column1: bmwlego,"2007-12-30T12:18:34.217Z","Hamburglar's Getaway Plane","The Hamburglar has flown off with McDonald's hamburgers. This was part of a Happy Meal at Mickey D's and included green plates. There was a time that the only green plates I had were from this set. The slope has a printed picture of the Hamburglar on it and there is a propeller and set of wheels included too. Not a bad happy meal toy, much better than the Bionicle stuff included in Happy Meals now.",FALSE,3,0,0,0,0
Pepper,"2011-03-13T18:17:25.957Z","the Hamburglar will steal your hamburgers!","
column2: This set was available at McDonalds in Happy Meals back in 1998.&nbsp
column3: It consists of some basic bricks along with a special printed brick with&nbsp
column5: on it that was exclusive to this set. These happy meal sets were my very first legos.

column1: It includes mostly basic bricks and plates. It also comes with a propeller and an exclusive printed brick. The printed
column2: brick has Hamburglar from the shoulders up printed on a normal 33 2x3 red slope brick.

column1: The plane is a very simple build. It has no interesting build techniques, but what can you expect from a happy meal promo?

This is a below average set. There is nothing overly special about it except for the printed brick, and even that's not that special. I wouldn't reccommend buying it, unless you find it for less than $0.25.

",TRUE,2,2,1,2,5

Lego_mini_fan,"2021-07-22T17:07:42.72Z","The hamburglars plane ","

Way back in 1999, lego and McDonalds collaborated and produced 8 sets that came with happy meals. Now onto the review!
This set consists of 13 parts. Which are 2 green plates, 2 small wheels, 2 black plates, 2 black bricks, a black piece to put the wheels on, 1 black slope, a green
column3: a yellow propeller and a special red printed slope of the hamburglar from McDonaldland.&nbsp

column1: The build of this set is simple and no special techniques are being used in the build, but the again this is a happy meal toy

column3: t recommend picking this up unless you get it for a good price or for the printed slope. In my opinion this is better than most of the McDonald&#39
